purpose: Using GOST R for TCert and ECert
text: <@U2E516363|astepanov> set the channel purpose: Using GOST R for TCert and ECert
<@U0S5KF44D|keithsmith> has joined the channel
<@U11MANG9G|jonathanlevi> has joined the channel
<@U221LL03Z|ashutoshkumar> has joined the channel

Just short brefing about the issue.
We building a inter-bank communication system, what use chaincode for tracking documents.

At first we need to use bank's issued GOST R cert to sign transactions in the blockchain. So TCert should turn into GOST R cert somehow.

On the second stage, we need to use some specific software (it's kinda approved by our government for crypto operations, called "СryptoPro"). It's also use GOST R, but the point is - every transaction should be signed by this software. 

For now I wondering about first stage. Is there is any solution to use GOST R cert as a TCert?
If it's better we can make a call about it
so , you need to expose an API for certificate signing using GOST R.
we are using GOLANG for Cert Signing and Golang does not support GOST R AFAIK.
I am sure your CA will not give you its Private Key to sign.
what we are talking about here is : TCert generation using COP.
the API has to be exposed by your CA.
Supporting second stage is WIP right now.
I think a call would be better :slightly_smiling_face:
I have a conf call # we could use if you want, but would be good if Jonathan can also join
<@U11MANG9G> Let us know you availability ... we may need to schedule for tomorrow
Tomorrow will be a bit better for me.
If that’s OK?
Great, what time tomorrow ok for you?
11am EST?
Ooops, may be at Monday than?
Works for me, though Monday is a day off in the US. In 3 hours can work too.
I just have 2 long meetings in a row. I preparing for the first one now
It will be deep night in my TZ, sorry. I prefer Monday or Tuesday (if it's better for you)
Do you want to try now, for 15 mins?
I'm in
I am fine.
Let me speak my mind the problem that I am forseeeing.
If Golang does not have support for GOST R , we are toast as they might not have corresponding curve.
Our Key Derivation function is based on EC Curve.
<@U2E516363> , can you please send me the Enrollment Cert using GOST R for my testing before the call ?
too late?  I can now
I don't have any yet
i guess Jonathan has 5 min now
can we have call after <@U2E516363> send the cert ?
don't have time now anyway
I am open.
next week?
that will work for me.
OK, next week, yes.
All we have now is a requirements from customer. I think it will took time to get it
I'll do some more reading.
There is some implementation of GOST R on Golang, but they not official
<@U2E516363> , I'll look into that.
Thanks, I will request a cert sample, hope it will work out
if you have some link on GOST R support on Golang, please send it my way.
Sure, I will sent you a pm
There is common saying , you give developers Pizza and Beer , you'll get your work done.
looking forward to it.
